ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my Chinese skills and enjoyed the class.
I learned Mandarin Chinese more in depth. There was a heavy focus on speaking and using accurate tone marks.
I improved my knowledge of chinese vocabulary, grammar, and culture. I also practiced speaking, reading, and writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course improves Chinese from all angles: listening, speaking, reading, and writing. The weakness is that the course isn't rigorous enough, averaging around an hour of homework per day. There's no chance to accelerate the learning of Chinese for someone ready to put in more work.

I think it would be beneficial to have more opportunities to speak at length without having prepared. For oral homework, I and others often wrote out answers first and then read them aloud. I don't think this was good for our speaking abilities.

Strengths - very organized and well planned. 
Weaknesses - can be very high workload and difficult at times, but my Chinese definitely improved significantly!

I think that there is a lot of busy work, and trying to spice up the assignments with something fun every chapter might make it more fun. A strength of the class though is that it touches on all four key aspects of language very well -- speaking, listening, writing and reading are equally weighed in terms of curriculum.

The teachers, regular homework assignments, and assessments were all excellent and fair. I really don't think there is much room for improvement because Chinese is always one of my favorite classes at Yale.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely. My Chinese improved significantly from the class.
Yes, definitely if you want to improve Chinese skills
I would definitely recommend the class for anyone that has a high level of mandarin Chinese knowledge.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student. Everything about it was great, and I looked forward to attending each class.
